net_income_entity_vs_property.explanation: PDF net income (YTD actual) is R1,398,102 from the Broll income statement. GL ebitda_recurring (10m YTD) is R-6,398,919.80 (GL sign convention: negative = profit, so absolute = R6,398,919.80). The R5.0M difference is mainly explained by: (1) the GL includes revenues and costs handled at entity level (e.g. property management fees R237,989, direct utility costs in COGS R1,774,376) that do not flow through the Broll property I/S, (2) GL recognizes full entity-level opex (legal fees R335,550, ad-hoc R844,828, finance charges R2,513,706 -- the latter excluded from ebitda_recurring), (3) different recognition timing due to the Broll report running to 12 Dec vs GL monthly cut-offs, and (4) the asset management fee is R60,500 in Broll vs R73,185 in GL. The Broll report is a property-level management view; the GL is the full entity view.

revenue_report_vs_gl.explanation: PDF total income (YTD) is R3,469,893 from Broll income statement pg 2. GL gross_profit (10m) is R-5,381,796.00 (absolute R5,381,796). Difference of R1.9M is explained by: (1) GL revenue includes all recovery streams and COS netting (e.g. GL total revenue is R7,156,172 less COGS R1,774,376 = R5,381,796 gross profit), while Broll bundles recoveries and costs differently in their property-level format, (2) GL captures entity-level items (solar sales R2,720,420, municipal electricity prepaid R323,725, other income R41,729) that are not in the Broll property I/S, (3) timing differences in the 10-month cut-off.

insured_vs_book.explanation: Building sum insured R91,375,000 from Dec 2025 insurance schedule. AFS investment property R75,127,871 as at Feb 2025 year end (per reviewed AFS). The insured value exceeds book value by R16.2M (21.6% over-insured relative to AFS carrying value). Note: the AFS value was written down from R90M to R75.1M at Feb 2025 year end due to a R14.9M fair value adjustment. The insurance was not adjusted downward to match. Also, the property was sold during the current FY for R72.6M (per GL sale of property account), so the insurance was evidently set before the revaluation and sale.

_calculation_notes.collections_efficiency: 6 out of 11 tenants making full payments = 55%; payment profile: 55% full, 27% short, 9% legal, 9% arrangements
_calculation_notes.trading_density: Centre average monthly trading density R6,311.50/m2 (from executive summary R6,299.47 annual average; R6,387 stated in turnover section heading)
_calculation_notes.property_net_income_monthly: YTD net income R1,398,102 / 10 months = R139,810.20 per month
_calculation_notes.lease_expiry_concentration_12m: 927 m2 expiring within 12 months / 3446 m2 total GLA = 26.93% (5 leases: Hao Ke Lai 84m2, Queens Pet Shop 325m2, Meander Pharmacy 358m2, Checkers Liquor 160m2 -- noting Bob Box 1m2 is negligible)
_calculation_notes.insurance_vs_book_ratio: R91,375,000 insured / R75,127,871 AFS book value = 1.216 (21.6% over-insured)
_calculation_notes.utility_recovery_composite: Weighted average of recovery percentages: electricity 141%, rates 25%, refuse 124%, sewer 77%, water 75%. Using equal weighting: (141+25+124+77+75)/5 = 88.4%. Rates drag overall recovery substantially below 100%.
_calculation_notes.has_solar_pv: Yes - solar PV system operational, 34.83 MWh produced in December 2025
_calculation_notes.has_active_capex: Yes - R237,166 spent YTD of R545,000 budget for water tanks, painting, paving
_calculation_notes.national_tenant_pct: National tenants (Checkers 1522m2 + Checkers Liquor 160m2 + Nedbank ATM 9m2 - note Checkers Mezzanine 500m2 counted above) = 1682m2 / 3446m2 = 48.82%. Using occupancy certificates: Checkers Shop 11 = 1522m2, Checkers Mezzanine 11 = 500m2, Checkers Liquor Shop 13 = 160m2, Nedbank ATM = 9m2 = total 2191m2 but mezzanine is included in total GLA.
_calculation_notes.anchor_count: 1 anchor: Shoprite/Checkers (Shop 11 + Mezzanine 11 = 1522+500=2022m2; plus Shop 13 Checkers Liquor 160m2). Nedbank is an ATM only, not an anchor.
_calculation_notes.weighted_escalation: Cannot compute - individual escalation rates not disclosed in the management pack for most tenants. Queens Pet Shop renewal mentions 7% escalation (budget 6%). Kiosk rental escalated at 7% (budget 6%). Insufficient data for weighted average.
